citation.biblCit: CBS News/The New York Times. CBS NEWS/NEW YORK TIMES MONTHLY POLL #2, MARCH 1995 [Computer file]. ICPSR version. New York, NY: CBS News [producer], 1995. Ann Arbor, MI: Inter- university Consortium for Political and Social Research [distributor], 1996.

subject.topcClas: XIV. MASS POLITICAL BEHAVIOR AND ATTITUDES
C. Public Opinion on Political Matters

stdyInfo.abstract: This poll is part of a continuing series of monthly surveys that solicit public opinion on the presidency and on a range of other political and social issues. Specific questions covered respondents' opinions of Bill Clinton, Jesse Jackson, Newt Gingrich, Ross Perot, Bob Dole, and Colin Powell. The survey addressed in detail the possible combinations of presidential election candidates and asked respondents to forecast their vote in each given situation. Other questions asked whether respondents were spending more or less on clothes and whether they subscribed to cable television and watched C-SPAN. Background information on respondents includes voter registration status, household composition, vote choice in the 1992 presidential election, political party, political orientation, education, age, sex, race, religious preference, and family income.

sumDscr.universe: adult population of the United States aged 18 and over having telephones at home

dataColl.sampProc: A variation of random-digit dialing using primary sampling units (PSUs) was employed, consisting of blocks of 100 telephone numbers identical through the eighth digit and stratified by geographic region, area code, and size of place. Within households, respondents were selected using a method developed by Leslie Kish and modified by Charles Backstrom and Gerald Hursh (see Backstrom and Hursh, SURVEY RESEARCH [Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press, 1963]).
dataColl.resInstru: structured, with 4 open-ended questions: Q10, Q28 Q33 AND Q39A. Voluntary responses are coded in Questions 11 - 15, 17, 18, 25, 26, 34, 37, 40, 46 - 48, 51, 53, 54.
dataColl.weight: A weight variable has been included and must be used for any analysis

setAvail.accsPlac: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research
setAvail.notes: ICPSR created an appendix to the codebook to clarify codes for many of the standard demographic variables

useStmt.citReq: Publications based on ICPSR data collections should acknowledge those sources by means of bibliographic citations. To ensure that such source attributions are captured for social science bibliographic utilities, citations must appear in footnotes or in the reference section of publications. The bibliographic citation for this data collection is: CBS News/The New York Times. CBS NEWS/NEW YORK TIMES MONTHLY POLL #2, MARCH 1995 [Computer file]. ICPSR version. New York, NY: CBS News [producer], 1995. Ann Arbor, MI: Inter- university Consortium for Political and Social Research [distributor], 1996.
useStmt.deposReq: REQUEST FOR INFORMATION ON USE OF ICPSR RESOURCES: To provide funding agencies with essential information about use of archival resources and to facilitate the exchange of information about ICPSR participants' research activities, users of ICPSR data are requested to send to ICPSR bibliographic citations for each completed manuscript or thesis abstract. Please indicate in a cover letter which data were used.
useStmt.disclaimer: DATA DISCLAIMER: The original collector of the data, ICPSR, and the relevant funding agency bear no responsibility for uses of this collection or for interpretations or inferences based upon such uses.

fileTxt.fileName: CBS NEWS/NEW YORK TIMES MONTHLY POLL #2, MARCH 1995

qstn.qstnLit: Do you approve or disapprove of the way Bill Clinton is handling his job as president?
Do you approve or disapprove of the way Congress is handling its job?
Is your opinion of Jesse Jackson favorable, not favorable, undecided, or haven't you heard enough about Jesse Jackson yet to have an opinion?
Is your opinion of Newt Gingrich favorable, not favorable, undecided, or haven't you heard enough about Newt Gingrich yet to have an opinion?
Is your opinion of Bill Clinton favorable, not favorable, undecided, or haven't you heard enough about Bill Clinton yet to have an opinion?
Is your opinion of Ross Perot favorable, not favorable, undecided, or haven't you heard enough about Ross Perot yet to have an opinion?
Is your opinion of Bob Dole favorable, not favorable, undecided, or haven't you heard enough about Bob Dole yet to have an opinion?
Is your opinion of Colin Powell favorable, not favorable, undecided, or haven't you heard enough about Colin Powell yet to have an opinion?
If you had to choose, would you say your opinion of Colin Powell is favorable or not favorable?

var.name: Q10

qstn.qstnLit: What do you like BEST about Colin Powell?

catgry.labl: NOT A POLITICIAN / HAS NEVER HELD OFFICE
FAMILY MAN / MARRIED / HAS KIDS / FAMILY VALUES
SELF-MADE MAN / SON OF IMMIGRANTS / FROM POOR BACKGROUND
HAS NO POLITICAL PARTY / IS AN INDEPENDENT / ABOVE POLITICS
GENERALLY GOOD MAN / FAIR / DOWN TO EARTH
MISCELLANEOUS PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS: poise, well-educated; intelligent; knowledgeable; appearance

var.notes: categories represent coded answers to open-ended question

qstn.qstnLit: If the 1996 presidential election were being held today, and the candidates were Bill Clinton, the Democrat, and Bob Dole, the Republican, would you vote for Bill Clinton or Bob Dole?
If the 1996 presidential election were being held today, and the candidates were Bill Clinton and Colin Powell, would you vote for Bill Clinton or Colin Powell?

If the 1996 presidential election were being held today, and the candidates were Bill Clinton, the Democrat, Bob Dole, the Republican, and Colin Powell, the independent, would you vote for Bill Clinton, Bob Dole, or Colin Powell?

If the 1996 presidential election were being held today, and the candidates were Bill Clinton, the Democrat, Bob Dole, the Republican, and Ross Perot, the independent, would you vote for Bill Clinton, Bob Dole, or Ross Perot?

If the 1996 presidential election were being held today, and the candidates were Bill Clinton, the Democrat, Bob Dole, the Republican, and Jesse Jackson, the independent, would you vote for Bill Clinton, Bob Dole, or Jesse Jackson?
Do you think Colin Powell should run as a candidate for president in 1996, or should he run as a candidate for vice president in 1996, or don't you think he should run in 1996 at all?
In the 1996 presidential election, if the candidates were Bill Clinton, the Democrat, Bob Dole, the Republican, and Colin Powell, the independent, who do you think WOULD win?

Do you think most people who support Colin Powell for president in 1996 support him because they really want him to be president, OR do you think most people support him because they just don't like the candidates who are now running for president?

Many candidates who plan to run for president in 1996 have already announced their plans to run. If Colin Powell is considering running for president in 1996, do you think he should announce that he is going to run soon, or do you think it's okay for him to wait as long as he wants to announce?
Do you think Colin Powell has strong qualities of leadership, or not?
Do you have a clear idea of what Colin Powell stands for, or don't you?
In general, do you think Colin Powell cares about the needs and problems of people like you, or not?
Do you think Colin Powell could be trusted to deal with all the problems a President has to deal with, or are you concerned that he might make serious mistakes?
Do you think you know enough about where Colin Powell stands on issues, or do you need to know more?
Do you think Colin Powell is a Republican, is a Democrat, is an Independent, or what?
Well, do you think of Colin Powell as closer to the Republican party or closer to the Democratic party?
How would you describe Colin Powell's views on most political matters -- Generally, do you think of Colin Powell as liberal, moderate, or conservative?

var.name: Q28

qstn.qstnLit: What one issue do you MOST want to know Colin Powell's position on?

catgry.labl: GUN CONTROL / RIGHT TO BEAR ARMS
FOREIGN POLICY / U.S. ROLE IN FOREIGN AFFAIRS / FOREIGN AID

var.notes: categories represent coded answers to open-ended question

qstn.qstnLit: Do you think Colin Powell is better able to address the needs and problems of African Americans because of his race, or don't you think his race affects his ability to do that?

catgry.labl: BETTER ABLE TO ADDRESS AFRO-AMERICAN PROBLEMS

qstn.qstnLit: Some people say the country needs a NEW political party to compete with the Democratic and Republican parties in offering the best candidates for political office. Do you agree or disagree?
Do you think a president who was not a Republican or a Democrat could govern effectively, or do you think such a president would have serious problems dealing with Congress?
Do you agree or disagree that the government would work better if all new people were elected?

var.name: Q33

qstn.qstnLit: Is there any ONE issue that you care about that would make you vote AGAINST a candidate for president? IF YES: What issue is that?

catgry.labl: GUN CONTROL / RIGHT TO BEAR ARMS
FOREIGN POLICY / U.S. ROLE IN FOREIGN AFFAIRS / FOREIGN AID

var.notes: categories represent coded answers to open-ended question

qstn.qstnLit: ASKED OF COLIN POWELL VOTERS IN QUESTIONS 12 AND 13: If you found out that Colin Powell disagreed with you on an issue that was important to you, would that make you less likely to vote for him, or wouldn't it make a difference one way or the other?

Which of these comes closest to your view? 1. Abortion should be generally available to those who want it; OR 2. Abortion should be available but under stricter limits than it is now; OR 3. Abortion should not be permitted?

Now I have some questions on a different subject. Think about the money you spend on clothes for yourself. Would you say that compared with two or three years ago you are spending more of your income on clothes for yourself, less of your income on clothes for yourself, or are you spending about the same?

qstn.ivuInstr: ASK QUESTIONS 37-39 OF THOSE WHO ARE SPENDING LESS
qstn.qstnLit: Which kinds of clothes have you cut back on -- mostly clothes for work, mostly casual clothes, or mostly formal or party clothes?

qstn.ivuInstr: ASK QUESTIONS 37-39 OF THOSE WHO ARE SPENDING LESS
qstn.qstnLit: What's the main reason you've managed to spend less on clothes -- do you buy fewer items of clothing, do you buy more of your clothes on sale, do you buy more of your clothes from discount stores, or is it something else?

qstn.ivuInstr: ASK QUESTIONS 37-39 OF THOSE WHO ARE SPENDING LESS
qstn.qstnLit: Are you using the money you had been spending on clothes for anything specific?
What?

catgryGrp.catgry: C1V41 C2V41 C3V41 C4V41 C5V41 C6V41

catgry.labl: HAVE NEW EXPENSE: HAD A BABY, BOUGHT A HOUSE, ETC.

qstn.qstnLit: Compared to the clothes you bought two or three years ago, are the clothes you're buying today of better quality, the same quality or not as good quality?
How important is it to you to wear the latest fashions -- very important, somewhat important, or not important?

qstn.preQTxt: My last few questions are for background only
qstn.qstnLit: Have you yourself ever served in the U.S. armed forces or the U.S. reserves?
Do you frequently listen to political call-in shows on radio, or don't you?
Do you think of yourself as a member of the religious right movement, or don't you?
Are you currently employed?
Do you subscribe to cable television?
Do you regularly watch C-Span?
How much attention do you pay to news about politics and government -- a lot, some, or not much?
Some people are registered to vote and others are not. Are you registered to vote in the precinct or election district where you now live, or aren't you?

Did you vote for U.S. House of Representatives in the elections held this past November, did something prevent you from voting, or did you choose not to vote for U.S. House of Representatives this past November?
Did you vote for the Republican candidate or the Democratic candidate in your district?

catgry.labl: VOTED, WON'T SAY HOW OR OTHER (VOL.)

qstn.qstnLit: Did you vote for President in 1992, did something prevent you from voting, or did you choose not to vote for President in 1992?
Did you vote for George Bush, Bill Clinton or Ross Perot?

catgry.labl: VOTED, WON'T SAY FOR WHOM OR OTHER (VOL.)

qstn.qstnLit: Generally speaking, do you usually consider yourself a Republican, a Democrat, an Independent, or what?
Do you think of yourself as closer to the Republican party or to the Democratic party?

Who would you like to see the Republican party nominate as its presidential candidate in 1996 ---- Lamar Alexander, Pat Buchanan, Bob Dole, Robert Dornan, Phil Gramm, Richard Lugar (LOO-gar), Colin Powell, Arlen Specter, or Pete Wilson?

qstn.ivuInstr: IF SELF-IDENTIFIED DEM OR REP, ASK OF OPPOSITE PARTY
qstn.qstnLit: Have you ever voted for (A DEMOCRAT) (A REPUBLICAN) for President?

qstn.ivuInstr: IF SELF-IDENTIFIED DEM OR REP, ASK OF OPPOSITE PARTY
qstn.qstnLit: If you found out that Colin Powell was a (A DEMOCRAT) (A REPUBLICAN), would that make you more likely to vote for him, less likely to vote for him, or wouldn't that matter to you one way or the other?

catgry.labl: WOULDN'T VOTE FOR COLIN POWELL AT ALL (VOL.)

qstn.qstnLit: How would you describe your views on most political matters? Generally do you think of yourself as liberal, moderate, or conservative?
What is your marital status? Are you now married, widowed, divorced or separated, or have you never been married?
Are you white, black, or some other race?
Are you of Hispanic origin or descent, or not?
Was your total family income in 1994 UNDER or OVER $30,000?
Was it under or over $15,000?
Was it between $30,000 and $50,000, or between $50,000 and $75,000 or was it over $75,000?
Are there any other telephone numbers in your home that I could have dialed and reached you on -- I don't mean extensions, but different telephone numbers?
We need to know how hard or easy it is to reach people.
Now I dialed you at TELEPHONE NUMBER, how many other numbers are there in your home?
CBS News and The New York Times may want to call you back sometime to ask more of your opinions. In order to make sure we reach you again, may I have your first name only.

var.name: CENREG
var.notes: Census Region Codes are same as CBS codes except Delaware, District of Columbia, Maryland and West Virginia are coded South (not Northeast)

var.name: COL1
var.notes: Processing Note: Please disregard the Collapsed Field Variable. It is for CBS use only.

otherMat.notes: CENSUS REGION CODES: Same as CBS code except Delaware, District of Columbia, Maryland, and West Virginia are coded as SOUTH (not NORTHEAST)

row.entry: Registered / Registration not necessary: 1=Registered / Registration not necessary; 2=Not registered and need to be to vote; 9=DK

Metro status code: 1=Central city of multi-county SMSA; 2=Not in central city, but in county containing all/part of the central city; 3=Suburban county of the SMSA; 4=In an SMSA consisting of just one county; 5=Not in an SMSA
